business.headline: Should you let AI analyse your online spending habits?Artificial intelligence is gradually slipping into our wallets. From tracking what we buy to predicting our next expense, AI-based tools are becoming popular. But should you really let AI analyse your online spending habits?

Trade deal talks hit roadblock as US delegation's India visit could be delayedThe India-US trade deal talks face a potential roadblock as the US delegation may delay its August 25 visit to India. This postponement impacts scheduled negotiations that were crucial for preventing additional tariffs. A 50% tariff on Indian goods is set to take effect from August 27. Currently, a 25% tariff is already in place, impacting exporters. The deferment of the meeting does not signify cancellation, but rather a delay. Reasons for the delay could be operational or related to geopolitical outcomes. "A 50% tariff will be imposed on us from August 27 in totality." The BTA deal is anticipated by the end of September or October, with expectations for a meeting by the end of August, contingent on geopolitical developments.

Trade deal in limbo as US team's India visit deferred amid tariff warThe United States has been pressing India to open its agriculture and dairy sectors, but New Delhi has ruled out concessions, saying such moves would endanger small farmers and cattle rearers.

Real wallet-friendly shake-up: GST 2.0 to feel like 'Good and Simple Tax'The government is set to launch GST 2.0 with major rate cuts, making essentials cheaper and simplifying tax slabs. The overhaul promises lower prices, fewer complications, and a true 'Good and Simple Tax'.

What nobody tells you about buying motor insuranceWhile car sales are climbing, many buyers remain unaware about the finer points of motor insurance, a gap that can cost them money and create problems when making a claim.

Government proposes 5%, 18% GST slabs; tobacco at 40%, relief for farmers: SourcesThe government has proposed reducing GST to two slabs: 5% and 18% with sin goods at 40%, aiming to cut taxes on essentials like farm products, health items, handicrafts, and insurance.

Credit ratings decoded: How a simple upgrade can change a country's fortuneGlobal credit rating agency S&P Global has upgraded India's long-term unsolicited sovereign credit rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB-'.

GST council meeting in September, 12% slam may be dropped: SourcesTwo-day GST Council meetings are expected in September to pave the way for reforms. The announcement was made by the Prime Minister from the ramparts of the Red Fort. These reforms are seen as a Diwali gift for the middle class. Key changes include the removal of the 12% GST slab and rate rationalisation for health and life insurance policies. The government aims to reduce the GST on most items currently in the 12% slab to 5%. This move is expected to make essential items such as footwear, bags, clothes, and toothpastes more affordable. The government is addressing concerns about inflation and the rising cost of living. Feedback regarding health insurance, which impacts the common person, has also been considered. The meetings in September are crucial for approving these changes, with implementation anticipated before Diwali. The Finance Ministry and state finance ministers have been involved in the process.

GST Council may drop 12% slab, more tax reforms in September meeting: SourcesThe meeting comes after Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his Independence Day speech, announced plans for a major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) system.

Claiming bias, same-sex couple approaches court over uneven tax: ReportThe petition was admitted by a bench of Justice BP Colabawalla and Justice Firdoush Pooniwalla, which has also issued a notice to the Attorney General as the case raises a constitutional question.

PM Modi announces next-generation GST reform with significantly lower ratesDuring his Independence Day address, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a sweeping overhaul of the GST system, promising to unveil a "next-generation" tax regime with substantially lower rates this Diwali, which he hailed as a festive gift from the Centre.

Rs 15,000 from government on 1st private-sector job: PM's big youth schemePM Modi in his Independence Day speech said that the Pradhan Mantri Viksit Bharat Rojgar Yojana will create nearly 3.5 crore new employment opportunities for the youth.

entertainment.headline: Coolie box office Day 3: Rajinikanth film storms past Rs 250 crore worldwideRajinikanth's 'Coolie' continues its unstoppable run at the box office, raking in Rs 158.25 crore domestically in just three days. The film has become the highest-grossing Tamil release of 2025.

War 2 box office Day 3: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR film witnesses a sharp dropOn Day 3, 'War 2' collected around Rs 33 crore in India, bringing its three-day total to nearly Rs 143–144 crore. Despite the dip, Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's film has crossed Rs 200 crore worldwide and emerged as the seventh highest-grossing Bollywood release of 2025.

Parag Tyagi gets wife Shefali Jariwala's face tattooed on his chest. VideoParag Tyagi paid a heartfelt tribute to his late wife Shefali Jariwala by getting her portrait tattooed on his chest, keeping her memory close to his heart.

Vijay Deverakonda represents India at New York's India Day parade. WatchActor Vijay Deverakonda celebrated Independence Day by proudly representing India at the India Day parade in New York City. He participated in flag-hoisting ceremonies and greeted fans at Times Square.

Nakuul Mehta, wife Jankee welcome baby girl share adorable pics from hospitalActor Nakuul Mehta and his wife Jankee have welcomed their second child, a baby girl, sharing the joyous news with fans through a heartfelt Instagram post. The couple's son Sufi was lovingly included in the announcement, holding his newborn sister in the first picture.

Jaideep Ahlawat's impromptu bhangra steals the show at IFFM 2025, fans want moreJaideep Ahlawat set the stage on fire with his impromptu bhangra at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025, leaving the audience and Malaika Arora cheering for more. The actor also bagged the Best Actor - Web Series award for his role in 'Paatal Lok 2'.

Aryan Khan flips the script with his bold Bads of Bollywood first lookAryan Khan's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' teaser has generated excitement by blending love and critique of Bollywood, with the show slated for release in 2025.

How Coolie fever gripped India 40 years agoWhile Rajinikanth-starrer Coolie might seem to break all the fandom craze, India saw something similar, if not more, in 1983 when Amitabh Bachchan's Coolie hit the theatres. It was during the shooting of Coolie that Big B sustained a life-threatening injury and the whole country prayed for him. So, when the film was released, anticipation was sky-high and fans turned theatres into temples for Amitabh worship.

Anita Advani says she secretly married Rajesh Khanna: He made me wear mangal sutraAnita Advani has revealed that she was privately married to the late Bollywood superstar Rajesh Khanna, adding a new dimension to his personal life story.

Janhvi Kapoor mobbed during Dahi Handi event in Mumbai, actor maintains calmJanhvi Kapoor encountered a crowd surge while promoting 'Param Sundari' at a Mumbai Dahi Handi event amidst Janmashtami celebrations. Videos from the event were shared online.

Shah Rukh Khan shuts down troll asking him to retire with witty replyShah Rukh Khan engaged fans on X with a lively #AskSRK session, where he schooled a troll suggesting retirement. During the session on Saturday, he also updated fans about his recovery, 'King', and son Aryan's directorial debut.

2025: A year that documented the fall of greats in Tamil cinemaMani Ratnam, Shankar, Kamal Haasan, Suriya, and AR Murugadoss's films were criticised for their creations in 2025. This raises a pertinent question about the audience's changing tastes.

SRK talks about son Aryan's directorial debut Bads of Bollywood, confirms cameoShah Rukh Khan praised his son Aryan Khan's directorial debut 'B**ds of Bollywood' during his #AskSRK session, calling it very entertaining, wacky and emotional. The first look of the series will be unveiled on August 17.

Love speaks the loudest: Kiara Advani expresses gratitude to fans after War 2 successAyan Mukerji's 'War 2', starring Hrithik Roshan, Kiara Advani and Jr NTR, crossed Rs 100 crore at the box office within two days of release. The cast, including Kiara, Hrithik and Jr NTR, shared heartfelt messages thanking fans for their love and support.

Sunny Deol says playing Hanuman in Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana is a big challengeSunny Deol, set to play Lord Hanuman in Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana', shared that the role is both exciting and challenging. He also expressed hope that the film's scale and effects will match Hollywood standards and satisfy audiences.

To our lion: Kareena's roar of love for husband Saif Ali Khan on his 55th birthdaySaif Ali Khan celebrated his 55th birthday on August 16. Heartfelt wishes from family, especially his wife Kareena Kapoor Khan and sisters Soha and Saba, poured in via Instagram.

Malaika Arora on co-parenting son Arhaan with ex Arbaaz: We have our boundariesMalaika Arora opened up about her divorce with Arbaaz Khan, saying co-parenting has its challenges but they have managed to maintain balance for their son Arhaan.

Vivek Agnihotri cries dictatorship as Kolkata blocks The Bengal Files trailer launchFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri faced significant hurdles during the trailer launch of his film 'The Bengal Files' in Kolkata. Despite the challenges and cancellations, the trailer was eventually unveiled, highlighting the film's exploration of West Bengal's turbulent political history and communal violence.

Anupam Kher attends Independence Day ceremony at Rashtrapati BhavanAnupam Kher attended the Independence Day At Home ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan, hosted by President Droupadi Murmu. The actor said he felt honoured and blessed to be part of the event.

general news.headline: Delhi gets Rs 11,000 crore road push as PM opens 2 highways to decongest capitalThe 10.1-km Delhi section of the Dwarka Expressway and a key stretch of UER-II, built at a combined cost of nearly Rs 11,000 crore, aim to ease traffic congestion and improve the capital's connectivity.

7 dead after cloudburst, landslide in J&K's Kathua, Army choppers join rescue opsSeveral houses were buried under rubble and floodwaters in the Ghati area, officials said. Damage was also reported on the Jammu–Pathankot National Highway. Rescue teams are at the spot.

With this treasure...: Asim Munir's 'rare earth' boast after oil deal with USAsim Munir's remarks come after US officials expressed interest in Pakistan's mineral reserves, which are vital for the electronics and defence sectors, as Washington seeks to break away from Chinese hegemony and reduce its dependency on Beijing's supply chains amid rising uncertainties.

Over 2 dozen bullets fired at Elvish Yadav's Gurugram home, attackers on the runElvish Yadav was not present at his residence when the firing took place. Bullets riddled the lower floors of the multi-storey house while the controversial YouTuber's family and caretaker remained inside.

Yes, stray dogs can be trained. Canine whisperers reveal howThe debate over Delhi's stray dogs has split the nation. While pet dogs are trained and groomed, street dogs have an entirely different image. Unlike what is popularly believed, strays can be trained, and their aggression largely reduced. Behaviourists and trainers who have trained stray dogs tell us how.

'He promoted betting app': Bhau Gang takes credit for Elvish Yadav house firingBhau Gang claimed responsibility for the early Sunday firing outside Elvish Yadav's Gurugram home, linking the attack to YouTuber's promotion of illegal betting apps.

Delhi man rapes mother twice after accusing her of having 'bad character'The complainant, accompanied by her 25-year-old daughter, approached cops and alleged that her son, Md Firoz, had assaulted and sexually abused her on multiple occasions this month.

Leopard attacks safari bus in Bengaluru, claws 12-year-old boy's hand. Video viralA safari ride at Bengaluru's Bannerghatta National Park turned tense after a leopard jumped onto a non-AC bus carrying tourists and clawed a 12-year-old boy.

Live: Rahul Gandhi kicks off Bihar Yatra to push Opposition's 'vote chori' claimVoter Adhikar Yatra Live Updates: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will begin a 16-day, 1,300-km "Voter Adhikar Yatra" from Sasaram today, with the Opposition-led INDIA bloc pitching it as a fight to protect the principle of "one person, one vote" ahead of the Bihar Assembly elections due later this year. The march, which will conclude with a mega rally in Patna on September 1, will be joined by Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav and other Mahagathbandhan politicians. It will cover 20 districts, including Gaya, Bhagalpur, Purnea, Darbhanga and West Champaran. The campaign will combine foot marches and road travel, similar to Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra held earlier this year ahead of the Lok Sabha polls. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

Trump to press Zelenskyy to cede key region to Russia at White House meet: ReportTrump's desire for Ukraine to give up its remaining territory in this key eastern region to end the war could remain elusive. Ahead of the Alaska meeting, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy firmly dismissed such a possibility, saying it would only pave the way for future war.

Caught on CCTV: Moment unidentified assailants opened fire at Elvish Yadav's homeCCTV footage has emerged showing unidentified assailants firing multiple rounds at the Gurugram residence of influencer Elvish Yadav. According to police, the incident occurred between 5:30 and 6:00 am, when three bike-borne men opened fire, spraying over two dozen bullets at Yadav's Sector 57 home, before fleeing the scene.

How relevant is vinyl in the times of Spotify? Hint: VeryVinyl sales are surging, and it's not just retro culture or nostalgia driving the boom. So why are young music lovers, raised on streaming apps and voice assistants, falling for this analog medium?
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

BJP leader kills wife at girlfriend's behest in Rajasthan's Ajmer, both arrestedBJP leader Rohit Saini murdered his wife Sanju in Ajmer on August 10, staging it as a robbery at the insistence of his girlfriend Ritu Saini. Police arrested both within 24 hours after exposing the conspiracy.

Reddit user's mother finds love in late 40s, Internet celebrates her new startA Reddit user shared in a now-viral post how their mother found the love of her life in her late 40s. The internet is cheering her on for a second chance at happiness.

Inside Odisha's ambitious dream of turning into a sporting powerhouseIf India indeed hosts the 2036 Olympics, Odisha will form the backbone of that dream. Here's why other states should take note of the state's ambitious sporting model.

Legal education in schools: Time to make it mandatory?With the Central Board of Secondary Education introducing a legal studies framework for Classes 11 and 12, the conversation has shifted towards preparing students for the legal and civic complexities of modern life. While the subject is often viewed as optional or specialised, its inclusion at the senior secondary level signals a broader recognition that understanding laws, rights, and responsibilities is essential to responsible citizenship in a changing society.
SUV driver runs over Jaipur man after collision, road rage caught on CCTVA jeep driver ran over a man in an act of aggression following a dispute over a car collision in Jaipur.

Why should we hire you? Bill Gates shares perfect answers for job interviewsBill Gates once role-played as a college dropout applying for his first job. His witty, practical answers with Stephen Curry reveal timeless lessons for job-seekers facing tough interview questions.

Saif Ali Khan-Kareena return to Mumbai after his 55th birthday bashSaif Ali Khan, who turned 55 on August 16, returned to Mumbai with wife Kareena Kapoor and their sons after a cosy family celebration.

sports.headline: Watch: Wolves' emotional tifo tribute for Diogo Jota leaves his family in tearsWolves fans unveiled a powerful tifo for Diogo Jota at Molineux, moving his family to tears. Former teammates, Manchester City players, and football leaders joined to honour the late star's legacy across English and European football.

FIFA supports Semenyo after racist abuse in Premier League openerBournemouth forward Antoine Semenyo has received backing from FIFA's Players' Voice Panel after being subjected to racist abuse during Friday's Premier League opener against Liverpool at Anfield.

Terence Atmane gifts Jannik Sinner Pokemon card on 24th birthdayFrench qualifier Terence Atmane surprised Jannik Sinner with a rare Pikachu card for his 24th birthday before their Cincinnati Open semi-final. Sinner dominated the match, winning 7–6 (4), 6–2 with 91 per cent first-serve success.

From tea stall to PKL glory: Puneri Paltan captain Aslam Inamdar gunning for moreFrom working in a tea stall to leading Puneri Paltan to their maiden Pro Kabaddi League title, Aslam Inamdar recalls his journey in the sport. Inamdar talks about his return from injury as he looks for more success in the upcoming season.

UFC 319: Khamzat Chimaev dominates Dricus du Plessis to win Middleweight titleKhamzat Chimaev dethroned Dricus du Plessis at UFC 319 with a dominant unanimous decision to become the new Middleweight champion on Saturday, August 16.

Baby AB title is a big burden to carry: Maxwell dissects Dewald Brevis's riseGlenn Maxwell has hailed Dewald Brevis's stunning rise while admitting the 22-year-old has carried the heavy weight of being branded "Baby AB." From IPL redemption to a record T20I century, Brevis is finally making his own name.

No Babar, Rizwan as Pakistan name squad for Asia Cup and UAE tri-seriesPakistan have left out Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan in their 17-member squad for the Asia Cup and the T20I tri-series, also involving Afghanistan and hosts UAE.

India dream intact, Yash Dhull says staying in the present is his top priorityYash Dhull says staying in the present is his mantra as the former India U-19 World Cup-winning captain looks to seise every opportunity, highlighted by a match-winning hundred in the Delhi Premier League.

Play like Dewald Brevis: South Africa coach wants players to show off a bit moreSouth Africa coach Shukri Conrad says his players must "show off more" like Dewald Brevis, despite the T20I series loss to Australia. Brevis starred for the Proteas with the bat during the three-match series.

Jasprit Bumrah confirms availability for India's Asia Cup squad: ReportIndia's premier fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has reportedly declared himself available for the forthcoming Asia Cup in Dubai. The tournament, scheduled to be held in the UAE from 9 to 28 September, will be contested in the T20 format.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
